title: X Factor Celebrity's Kevin McHale thinks a Glee reunion could happen
text:
Please tell us this is happening (Pictures: REX)

X Factor Celebrity contestant Kevin McHale would be surprised if a Glee reunion took place – but it could happen.

The former actor, who wowed the judges with his version ofLizzo‘s ‘Good As Hell’ on Saturday, said he gets asked the ‘Glee question’ all the time – so of course, we had to ask him again.

He told Metro.co.uk: ‘We are all friends so we get together all the time and I do get the reboot question a lot and who knows?

‘I can’t imagine it and I would be surprised, but if it happened it would need to be something different, where you can do it with a brand new cast.

‘And it’s based in a high school and they’re not going anywhere.’

Kevin, who played Artie Abrams in the teen musical, said his former Glee pals have all wished him well on his X Factor journey – although Amber Riley was mad she found out about it on Twitter.

Kevin as Artie from Glee (Picture: Patrick Ecclesine/Fox-Tv/Kobal/REX)

Back in the day! (Picture: Carin Baer/Fox-Tv/Kobal/REX/Shutterstock)

He added: ‘Jenna Ushkowitz (who played Tina Cohen-Chang) and I do a podcast together so she knew I was doing it. And Matt Morrison (who played teacher Will Schuester) knew I was taking part, we still talk so we know what each other is up to.

‘They also knew how much of a fan of The X Factor I was I have loved the show for years, so they are excited for me.’

In the auditions, Kevin admitted that he was ‘a bag of nerves’ after he didn’t receive the best reviews from the judges.

He explained: ‘I wasn’t expecting a bigger reaction at all, I was honestly happy to just get through it.

‘I didn’t think my performance was that great but I think more than anything I was proud to not have completely botched it. I am a bit rusty I haven’t performed live since the Glee tour in 2011.

‘I think everyone is going to be really surprised because from the judge’s houses to what we are doing in the first week, it’s going to be a completely different show. Everyone has stepped it up.’

The 31-year-old who shot to fame in 2009 and was also in a boyband called NLT revealed that despite his background in music, he doesn’t have an ‘advantage’ on the other contestants.

‘No I honestly don’t think that,’ he added.

‘I think I am the one most known to have done music in my past but if anyone takes anything from the first episode they will know that everyone is on an even playing ground.

‘In Glee, there were 80 of us and in the Glee tour, I think I only sang two songs. It is a really different thing to be out there by myself and I understand how it comes off that I might have an advantage but just know I don’t feel that.’
